arts.ttl: Stoke boss Mark Robins points to 'comfy slippers' theory on Coventry City return
arts.sum: Returning to the CBS Arena with his new club Stoke, the 55-year-old was applauded and treated to a chorus of “There’s only one Mark Robins,” from the 27,303 Sky Blues fans in a sell-out crowd of 30,011 after the final whistle of the game, in which the Potters battled back from two goals down only to concede the winer in the 97th minute. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard hails Coventry City character amid 'fake' game on Mark Robins' big return
arts.sum: The Sky Blues were two goals up at a packed CBS Arena where more than 30,000 fans saw Victor Torp time terrific runs into the Stoke box to head and then stroke home in the 22nd and 31st minutes before Ephron Mason-Clark was taken out by visiting goalkeeper Viktor Johansson in what the head coach felt should have been a clear penalty and “maybe” a red card as well. Frank Lampard was delighted to see his Coventry City side extend their incredible run to nine Championship wins out of 10, but felt the result should have been done and dusted by half-time against returning manager Mark Robins’ Stoke .

arts.ttl: Mark Robins picks out good, bad and unacceptable from dramatic Stoke City loss at Coventry
arts.sum: Robins was disappointed Stoke didn’t take the chances they forged in the early stages, furious with the three goals they conceded and in praise of their character to fight back and encouraged by the key players stepping up their returns from injury. Mark Robins picked out the good, bad and unacceptable from Stoke City’s dramatic defeat against a Coventry side that has now won nine out of their last 10 games.

arts.ttl: Coventry’s last-gasp win boosts playoff charge to sink Robins and Stoke
arts.sum: Bobby Thomas grabs added-time winner for Sky Blues Millwall come from behind for 2-1 victory at Watford Bobby Thomas scored a last-gasp winner to give Coventry a thrilling 3-2 win against Stoke at the CBS Arena. Victor Torp had scored a first-half double to put the Sky Blues ahead before substitute Sam Gallagher netted two of his own to haul Stoke level. But Thomas sent the home fans into raptures in the seventh minute of added time when he thumped home to earn his side a ninth win in 10 league outings. The fixture was also the return of Stoke’s manager Mark Robins after he was sacked by the Sky Blues in November. Robins’s seven-year reign featured two promotions, a Championship playoff final defeat to Luton on penalties and FA Cup semi-final heartbreak against Manchester United last season. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Coventry as hope turns to heartbreak
arts.sum: It was Stoke who were suddenly looking for the winner but instead it came at the other end as Bobby Thomas pounced on a half-clearance and found a gap past Viktor Johansson to cue wild celebrations in the home stands. And the hosts probably should have had a penalty in first half added time when Ephron Mason-Clark ran beyond the Stoke centre-backs and chipped it over Johansson on the stretch as the keeper bundled into him.

arts.ttl: Lampard's Coventry strike late to sink Stoke on Robins return
arts.sum: Bobby Thomas scored a last-gasp winner to give Coventry a thrilling 3-2 win against Stoke at the CBS Arena.

arts.ttl: Bobby Thomas scores late winner as Coventry beat Stoke in five-goal thriller
arts.sum: Thomas found the net deep into stoppage time.

arts.ttl: Coventry City consensus emerges after they send Mark Robins away empty handed
arts.sum: The Sky Blues were in command in the first half after Victor Torp's brace saw them stretch away from the struggling Potters; Torp first escaped his man and rose highest to head home a set piece, before he finished coolly in the penalty area beyond Stoke goalkeeper Viktor Johansson. Bobby Thomas, though, popped up deep in stoppage time to restore the lead and claim City's ninth win in the space of ten league games.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after 3-2 win against Mark Robins' Stoke
arts.sum: Victor Torp headed the Sky Blues into a 22nd minute lead when he timed his run to perfection to connect with a long throw from Milan van Ewijk after the home side had been forced to soak up some early pressure from the visitors, with Oliver Dovin forced to pull off an impressive reaction save to deny Lewis Koumas scoring in the opening minutes. Dovin made a couple of saves at his near post as Stoke launched a fight-back after the break and eventually got a goal back in the 66th minute when Wouter Burger evaded a Liam Kitching challenge in the box to feed Sam Gallagher for a tap-in.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs Coventry as key man returns
arts.sum: Wouter Burger returns to the Stoke City starting XI in Mark Robins' only change for a game against Coventry. "I’m not playing the game, it’s about them, how they’re prepared and how they can go and perform in front of 3,000 of our supporters.
